page.title: 07FREELAND PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: Freeland Primary School is a small school that looks like a house with yellow bricks and a pitched roof and fairly small windows. It was built in 1967. The school is surrounded by a wall but it is not very high, the grounds are mostly grass and they have a lot of sycamore trees. The field is on a slope and they have a football pitch and a running track. There is a netball court of tarmac which also has a 5-a-side football pitch marked on it. At the back of the school is a small swimming pool. There is a climbing frame in the school grounds. The school used to have a pet corner but it has over grown. They have four bird boxes next to the kitchen. There is a bike shed for 18 bikes, but there were no bikes in it even though the children were all at school.
